questions.text: Is climate action the core purpose or goal of the policy?
questions.answer: The Central Goldfields Climate Action Plan is indeed centered around climate action as its core purpose. The policy outlines a comprehensive approach to addressing climate change, including both mitigation and adaptation strategies. Mitigation strategies aim to reduce greenhouse gas emissions, while adaptation strategies prepare for unavoidable changes to the climate. The policy identifies six priority areas for action: Education, Collaboration & Mobilisation, Health & Wellbeing, Renewable Energy & Energy Efficiency, Built Environment & Transport, Waste & the Circular Economy, and Land & Water. The policy also emphasizes the importance of community engagement and collaboration in achieving its climate action goals. It outlines specific actions to be taken in the initial two years of the plan, demonstrating a commitment to immediate action.

quote.content: Both mitigation and adaptation goals are captured to ensure we are actively reducing our contribution to global greenhouse gas emissions, as well as preparing for and adapting to a changing climate.

questions.text: Does the document explicitly explain the need for action on climate change?
questions.answer: The Central Goldfields Climate Action Plan clearly articulates the need for action on climate change. The document acknowledges the urgency of global action on climate change, citing the World Research Institute's findings on the rise in global temperatures and the increase in natural disasters. It also references the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC) report, which warns of reaching the 1.5ºC level within the next two decades unless drastic cuts in carbon emissions are made. The document further emphasizes the responsibility of governments, businesses, individuals, and communities to take action to protect each other and the environment. It also outlines the legislative context, including the Paris Agreement and Australia's commitment to net zero emissions by 2050. The document's focus on both mitigation and adaptation strategies underscores the comprehensive approach required to address climate change.

quote.content: The latest Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC) report 2022 has warned that the world is set to reach the 1.5ºC level within the next two decades and only the most drastic cuts in carbon emissions from now will help prevent an environmental disaster. According to the World Research Institute, global temperatures have risen by 1.1ºC so far, and already we are seeing an increase in natural disasters such as flooding, fires, droughts and other climatic events.

questions.text: Does the document give specific timeframes for its intended actions on climate?
questions.answer: The Central Goldfields Climate Action Plan 2022-2030 does provide specific timeframes for its intended actions on climate change. The document outlines a plan for the local government to achieve net zero council emissions by 2030. It also details an implementation plan for the initial two years of the Climate Action Plan (2022-2024). The document further mentions that a partnership approach will be established within six months of the adoption of the plan, which will oversee, govern, and activate the implementation, monitoring, and evaluation of the plan. These specific timeframes indicate a clear sense of urgency and commitment to taking action on climate change.

questions.text: Does the plan include specific actions for mitigation of greenhouse gas emissions, including technological solutions and behaviour change?
questions.answer: The Central Goldfields Climate Action Plan does indeed include specific actions for the mitigation of greenhouse gas emissions. The plan outlines both technological solutions and behaviour change as part of its mitigation strategy. Technological solutions include the installation of rooftop solar, upgrading to energy efficient technologies, and the installation of electric vehicle charging stations. These actions aim to reduce greenhouse gas emissions by transitioning to renewable energy sources and improving energy efficiency. The plan also emphasizes the importance of behaviour change, such as home composting, which can reduce the amount of organic waste sent to landfill and thus decrease methane emissions. The plan's approach to mitigation is comprehensive, addressing both the supply (through technological solutions) and demand (through behaviour change) sides of greenhouse gas emissions.

quote.content: Mitigation – actions seeking to avoid and reduce greenhouse gas emissions in the atmosphere.

questions.text: Does the plan include specific actions for climate adaptation and resilience?
questions.answer: The Central Goldfields Climate Action Plan does indeed include specific actions for climate adaptation and resilience. The plan outlines a two-pronged approach to addressing climate change, which includes both mitigation and adaptation actions. The document provides examples of adaptation actions such as preparing for floods, storms, and fires, improving water efficiency, and building community resilience. The plan also outlines six priority areas for mitigation and adaptation, which include Education, Collaboration & Mobilisation, Health & Wellbeing, Renewable Energy & Energy Efficiency, Built Environment & Transport, Waste & the Circular Economy, and Land & Water. Furthermore, the plan includes specific actions such as investigating partnership opportunities to support resilience and connection, supporting sporting clubs to assess risks and adapt to increasing temperatures, and mapping opportunities to activate community cool zones. These actions demonstrate a comprehensive approach to climate adaptation and resilience.

questions.text: Does the document describe plans to conduct research in the local community, to inform climate actions?
questions.answer: The documents indeed describe plans to conduct research in the local community to inform climate actions. The local government has engaged in a collaborative approach to climate action, inviting the Central Goldfields community to participate. This approach included a series of community workshops that took place from August to November 2021. These workshops provided valuable insights and direction for the development of the Climate Action Plan. The local government also conducted targeted consultations with Council staff and regional service providers during the Plan's development. This was done to ensure that the Plan built on existing work and captured important opportunities. Furthermore, the local government plans to implement a community-led project, Climate Conversation Week, to gather insights from the broader community around risks and potential actions, which will inform the ongoing implementation of the Climate Action Plan.
